question: Question 29 Suppose that in an IP-over-Ethernet network, a machine X wishes to find the MAC address of another machine Y in its subnet. Which one of the following techniques can be used for this?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: X sends an ARP request packet to the local gateway's IP address which then finds the  MAC address of Y and sends to X
options.B: X sends an ARP request packet to the local gateway's MAC address which then finds the MAC address of Y and sends to X
options.C: X sends an ARP request packet with broadcast MAC address in its local subnet
options.D: X sends an ARP request packet with broadcast IP address in its local subnet
